sml:System.gml:description: Vantage Pro2™ (6152, 6153) and Vantage Pro2™ Plus (6162, 6163) Wireless Weather Stations include two components: the Integrated Sensor Suite (ISS) which houses and manages the external sensor array, and the console which provides the user interface, data display, and calculations. The ISS and Vantage Pro2 console communicate via an FCC‐certified, license‐free, spread‐spectrum frequency‐hopping (FHSS) transmitter and receiver. Userselectable transmitter ID codes allow up to eight stations to coexist in the same geographic area. The frequency hopping spread spectrum technology provides greater communication strength over longer distances and areas of weaker reception. The Wireless Vantage Pro2 Plus weather station includes two additional sensors that are optional on the Vantage Pro2: the UV sensor and the solar radiation sensor.
sml:System.gml:name: PTF - Wireless Vantage Pro2

sml:Term.sml:value: Piattaforma Acqua Alta - Davis Vantage Pro2
Present weather in the atmosphere by visual estimation and conversion to WMO code using table 4677/4501

gml:EngineeringDatum.gml:datumName: PTF Davis Vantage Pro2 Spatial Datum
gml:EngineeringDatum.gml:anchorPoint: Origin is at the base of mouting. Z is alog the axis of the mouting pole - typically vertical. X and Y are ortogonal to Z but undetermined
